channel.title: Comments on: UCT MAM1000 lecture notes part 37 – differential equations part vi – second order differential equations

item.title: By: Jonathan Shock
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Shock
item.description: Hi there, it looks right to me. Did you set the boundary conditions at 1, or at 0?
item.content:encoded: Hi there, it looks right to me. Did you set the boundary conditions at 1, or at 0?

item.title: By: Azhar Rohiman
item.dc:creator: Azhar Rohiman
item.description:
Dr. Shock, for your first example i) y'' - 2y' - y = 0. I got k1 to be ((2sqrt(2) + 5)(e^(sqrt(2)-1))) / (2sqrt(2)). I'm not sure if mine is correct though.
RHMMUH005.
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Shock, for your first example i) y” – 2y’ – y = 0. I got k1 to be ((2sqrt(2) + 5)(e^(sqrt(2)-1))) / (2sqrt(2)). I’m not sure if mine is correct though.

RHMMUH005.
